subject: Address: 601 E 12th St, Kans
body:
Address: 601 E 12th St, Kansas
City, MO 64106, United States
 
Attention:  
Not sure your serious. seems you are playing with our intelligence
 YOURS SINCERRLY
Mark E. Green

subject: Re:   Address: 601 E 12th St, Kans
body:
Hello Mark E. Green,

Thank you for reaching out to me from City, MO United States. I'm not quite sure what you mean by "playing with our". Could you please elaborate on that? I'm always eager to learn and understand more.

Looking forward to your response!

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Attention: Jean,,, READ AGAIN PLEASE
body:
UNITED STATES Department 

of the Treasury Trust Board

1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW  
Washington, D.C. 20220
Attention: Jean 

Thanks for getting back to us as you have confirmed your choice in having an ATM Master card issue and deliver to you as the awarded fund which is worth Two Hundred and Fifty thousand united United States Dollars will be loaded in the card as it will be automatically programmed and activate to withdraw $5000 daily which will be the daily limit for withdrawal per day

We have commence with your choice and the master card will be forwarded to the Security Delivery keeping company as explained that they are the one to have the ATM CARD deliver to you

We have verified from them of the cost in handling the delivery and they said it will cost you the sum of $285 for the cost of delivery and having it insured so includes the insurance cover fee as it's necessary that the ATM CARD is insured for delivery.

Now, here below is the contact information of the Security delivery company as you contact them as they inform you of the mode of payment for faster commencing of the delivery to you

Contact person: Mark E. Green

Email contact: UnitedStateskeepingcompany@usa.com


Yours sincerely

Janet Yellen

subject: Re: Attention: Jean,,, READ AGAIN PLEASE
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your prompt response. I'm thrilled to hear about the ATM Master card and the awarded fund of Two Hundred and Fifty thousand United States Dollars. That's quite a sum!

I understand that there will be a cost associated with the delivery and insurance of the ATM card, which seems reasonable. However, I didn't see any specific amount mentioned in your message. Could you please clarify how much exactly it would cost me?

Also, could you provide more details about the Security Delivery company? It would be great if you could share their contact information so I can get in touch with them directly.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
UNITED STATES Department 

of the Treasury Trust Board

1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW  

Washington, D.C. 20220
Attention :  Please

  The board has reviewed this transaction and they have agreed to reduce the release fee instead of the previous amount as requested before
The three options in having your fund release to you which is having  an ATM Card as the fund will be loaded in it and deliver to you by the United States Security Keeping Company? or better still having the fund transfer to you by a reputable Bank or having a cashiers cheque issue and deliver to you? any of these options will cost you same amount which is $155 as the board has reduced the fee to $155 instead of the previous amount 
So be informed that any option will cost you this same amount as you then make your choice between the mentioned option having noted the amount it will cost you 
Get back to us with your preferred choice as we then direct you to the next procedure in sending the $155 for the release of the fund based on the choice you will be making 


Yours sincerely

Janet Yellen

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your email. It's great to hear that the board has agreed to reduce the release fee. I appreciate this gesture.

Regarding the options for receiving my funds, could you please provide more details? For instance, if I choose the ATM card option, how will it be delivered to me? And in case of a bank transfer, which banks are considered reputable?

I'm also curious about the cashier's cheque. How does this process work and how long would it take for me to receive it?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
UNITED STATES Department 

of the Treasury Trust Board

1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW  

Washington, D.C. 20220
Attention :  Please

   Thanks for getting back to us. Now, if you choose the bank to bank transfer then we will direct you to the authorized bank which is United Community Bank was authorized to carry out the transfer to any of your Bank account . these is for the bank to bank transfer
And then if you wish to have the fund through ATM Card a debit master card will be issued in your name and the fund will be loaded into the Card and it will be activated for $2000 daily withdrawer.
 Which means the card will be activated in withdrawing $2000 daily if you choose this the ATM Card. if you choose the ATM Card the United states security keeping delivery company will have their diplomatic agent deliver the card to your home address,  it also implies to the cashiers cheque too the delivery company will have it delivered to you. for better explanation on the cashiers cheque this method is having a cheque worth the compensation amount which is TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY THOUSAND UNITED STATES DOLLARS issue in the check and once it is delivered you will just work into your bank and have the money cashed out that's all
so make your choice as we direct you to the authorized office based on your choice as you send the $155 for immediately for the release of your preferred choice 


Yours sincerely

Janet Yellen

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the options you've provided me with. I'm a bit confused though, could you please clarify a few things for me?

Firstly, if I choose the bank to bank transfer, how exactly will United Community Bank carry out this transfer? Will there be any fees associated with this process?

Secondly, regarding the ATM Card option, how does the daily activation work? Is there a limit on how much I can withdraw each day? Also, is there any cost involved in having the card delivered to my home address?

Lastly, about the cashier's cheque method - once it's delivered and I cash it out at my bank, are there any charges or fees that I should be aware of?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the options you've provided me with. It's quite interesting to know that I can receive the funds either through a bank transfer, an ATM Card or a cashier's cheque.

I'm curious about the ATM Card option. How does it work exactly? Will there be any charges associated with using this card? And how secure is this method?

Also, could you please provide more information about the bank transfer process? How long would it take for the funds to reflect in my account?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
UNITED STATES Department 

of the Treasury Trust Board

1500 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW  

Washington, D.C. 20220
Attention :  Please

    First with the Bank to Bank transfer. there is know extra fee that will be required just the $155 and the transfer will be made to you. you will only be requested to send your bank details that's and once the transfer is made in less than 3hours the reflection will take place into your own bank account and there will be know extra fee of any kind that will be required from you again just the $155 as explained
About the delivery of the ATM Card there will be know cost for withdrawer once the card is delivered to you. The withdrawer access pin will be attached to the ATM Card and it will be giving to you by the delivery agent and then you can go to any ATM machine and make a withdrawer  as explained previously you can only withdraw $2000 daily which means $2000 can be withdrawed as the card was activated to for withdraw only $2000 perday  
About the cashiers cheque there will be know cost having it cashed at your bank you will only go to your bank with a means of your identification card that's all.  it it will be issued in your name and address you will cash it at your bank without know hindrance or any blockage 
Note we have verified from the delivery company any of this option between the ATM CARD or the cashiers cheque. the delivery of it will be made to you not less than 2hours depending on your state 
We await your swift response  with your option as we believe you are cleared now with all these explanation 


Yours sincerely

Janet Yellen

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining these options to me. 

I'm a bit confused about the Bank to Bank transfer, though. You mentioned that there's no extra fee required, but then you referred to "just the". Could you please clarify what this means? 

Also, regarding the ATM Card delivery, could you tell me more about how it works? How will I receive the card and who will be delivering it? And is there a limit on how much I can withdraw daily?

Lastly, for the cashier's cheque option, is there any specific procedure I need to follow at my bank to cash it in?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Attention: Jean
body:
Hello Janet Yellen,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time you took to clarify these options for me. 

I'm a bit confused about the Bank to Bank transfer, though. You mentioned that there's no extra fee required, but then you referred to "just the". Could you please explain what "just the" means? 

Also, regarding the ATM Card option, it sounds very convenient! But I'm curious about how secure this method is? How can I be sure that my card and pin won't fall into wrong hands during delivery?

Lastly, about the cashier's cheque - it seems like a straightforward process. However, could there be any issues with my bank accepting a foreign cheque?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Jeanne
